poem:
Zohran in the Morning

In the city's wake,  
a name stirs: Zohran—  
painted bold in newspapers,  
fingers point, voices clash,  
red banners flutter,  
and shadows stretch longer.  
Yet, amid the din,  
the morning sun  
still kisses brownstones—  
unbothered, unfazed—  
as it always has.
